title: A debt collector is suing me, I think. So I need to hire a lawyer?
question: I got a letter from a A company Stating they can help me resolve this. So I looked up case and its been filed at courthouse by a lawyer from cach.
question_tags: LLC (limited liability company),Bankruptcy,Debt,Debt settlement,Consumer debt,Bankruptcy and debt
answers:
From the day you are served, you have 30 days to respond to the complaint or risk a default judgement being entered in against you - which occurs in roughly 9/10 collections cases, and is a worst case scenario for a Defendant.

You should immediately contact a consumer debt protection attorney regarding the lawsuit filed against you. Feel free to contact our offices for a free consultation on your rights.

Best of luck to you.
This case was probably filed by mandarich law group or one of the other two law firms that handles CACH matters. You should consult with a lawyer and have them help you defend this case.
If you have already been sued, it is prudent to hire a lawyer to ascertain the case, to timely respond to it, and to assist you in negotiating a settlement if a settlement is feasible.

You have been sued by CACH, LLC more than likely represented by the Law Office of Robert J. Colclough, III?

The lawsuit is real, but you are also being stalked by a "debt consolidation" company who is hoping to get fees from you but not really do anything to help you defend this lawsuit. Debt consolidation companies are notorious scammers. Avoid them and get proper legal representation.

You wrote, "A debt collector is suing me, I think. So I need to hire a lawyer?"

A: No.

But I suggest you need to consult with a local bankruptcy or consumer law attorney.
